item.title: Nicole add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "Be the change that you wish to see in the world." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: Nicole add a quote by Johann Wolfgang von Goethe
item.description: "Who are you then?" "I am part of that power which eternally wills evil and eternally works good." -- Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

item.title: Nicole add a quote by Johann Wolfgang von Goethe
item.description: "Whatever you can do or dream you can, begin it. Boldness has genius, power and magic in it!" -- Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

item.title: Nicole add a quote by Johann Wolfgang von Goethe
item.description: "Things which matter most must never be at the mercy of things which matter least." -- Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

item.title: Nicole add a quote by George Washington
item.description: "If freedom of speech is taken away, then dumb and silent we may be led, like sheep to the slaughter." -- George Washington

item.title: Nicole add a quote by Thomas Jefferson
item.description: "I cannot live without books." -- Thomas Jefferson

item.title: Nicole add a quote by Thomas Jefferson
item.description: "The legitimate powers of government extend to such acts only as are injurious to others. It does me no injury for my neighbor to say there are twenty gods or no god. It neither picks my pocket nor breaks my leg." -- Thomas Jefferson

item.title: Nicole add a quote by Thomas Jefferson
item.description: "Honesty is the first chapter of the book wisdom." -- Thomas Jefferson

item.title: Nicole add a quote by Thomas Jefferson
item.description:
"We took the liberty to make some enquiries concerning the ground of their pretensions to make war upon nations who had done them no injury, and observed that we considered all mankind as our friends who had done us no wrong, nor had given us any provocation.
The Ambassador [of Tripoli] answered us that it was founded on the Laws of their Prophet, that it was written in their Koran, that all nations who should not have acknowledged their authority were sinners, that it was their right and duty to make war upon them wherever they could be found, and to make slaves of all they could take as Prisoners, and that every Musselman who should be slain in battle was sure to go to Paradise.
{<i>Letter from the commissioners, [author:John Adams|1480] & Thomas Jefferson, to [author:John Jay|63860], 28 March 1786</i>}" -- Thomas Jefferson

item.title: Nicole add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "It is not a lack of love, but a lack of friendship that makes unhappy marriages." -- Friedrich Nietzsche
